ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] Digest Number 52
ygData.msgSnippet: Here s is something I just discovered, in terms of making and selling banded. People just don t give a shit how long it took you too make it, or how long it
ygData.messageBody:
Here's is something I just discovered, in terms of
making and selling banded. People just don't give a
shit how long it took you too make it, or how long it
took you to reach that skill. They could care less. If
you want their money, then you sell it cheap. This
really sucks I know, but that's why you can't sell it
as much as you would like. People just suck.

> Message: 1
> Date: Fri, 9 Jul 1999 08:07:20 -0400
> From: "Sturgill, Jim" <JimS@...>
> Subject: Sharpening stones
>
> About how much do the merchants in Freeport charge
> for a sharpening
> stone, and as a beginning level smith about 10 skill
> level how many
> weapons do I need to sharpen to increase this? Also
> does it increase
> faster the better the weapon you try to sharpen?
> Rusty to Tarnished
> then to what and does it continue to go up in
> quality to fine steel?
>
>
>
> >
>
>
>
_______________________________________________________________________________
>
_______________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 2
> Date: Fri, 9 Jul 1999 08:57:58 EDT
> From: MikeDiClem@...
> Subject: Re: Sharpening stones
>
> sharpening stones go for about 4 copper, VERY cheap.
> you can only sharpen
> them to tarnished, not fine steel. i did not sharpen
> things from skill 10, so
> i cannot answer your other question. i pumped 20
> skill points into it.
>
>
>
_______________________________________________________________________________
>
_______________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 3
> Date: Fri, 9 Jul 1999 09:26:44 -0400 (EDT)
> From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>
> Subject: Re: Sharpening stones
>
> The best thing about sharpening weapons for skill is
> that if you fail your
> skill roll, you only lose the sharpening stone, you
> keep the weapon.
> I think you should always make the easiest item that
> is not trivial. Start
> by sharpening rusty daggers, then move to short
> swords, on up
> to rusty two handed long swords which I hear help
> until skill 32.
>
> You will only be sharpening about 3-4 weapons per
> skill point,
> very cheap.
>
> David
> >
> > From: MikeDiClem@...
> >
> > sharpening stones go for about 4 copper, VERY
> cheap. you can only sharpen
> > them to tarnished, not fine steel. i did not
> sharpen things from skill 10, so
> > i cannot answer your other question. i pumped 20
> skill points into it.

> -----Original Message-----

>

> >From: kale usi <kaleusi@...>
> >
> >>From: Jeff Cosby <cosbyj@...>
> >>
> >>Blade molds are just a piece of a quest at the
> moment.. (Screaming Mace
> >>Quest)
> >>
> >
> >I know this. Was wondering if they have any
> significance or use.
>
>
> However, they don't have any real use in the quest.
> I have both an
> unfinished blade mold and an unfinished sledge mold
> I got from that
> dwarven blacksmith.
>
> Curious thing is, both are stackable, unlike every
> other mold I've run
> into. I wonder if you need multiples to do anything
> useful?
>
>
>
